I’m middle aged and hypersensitive to odors and fragrances.  I’ve noticed many people have TERRIBLE odor, including younger people.  I don’t mean poor hygiene or bad sweating, just their natural scents.  Ironically the more artificial fragrances they wear the WORSE they smell.  But I have noticed older men smell is usually the most off-putting to me.  What’s cruel is that my friends and family treat my hypersensitivity like an “allergy” to be “cured” by chronic, repeated exposure to the offensive odors.  They constantly force me into “incidental” situations where nasty people walk or stand very close to me, forcing me to smell them.  In extreme case I suffer severe symptoms including headaches, sore throat, runny nose and eyes, inflamed skin, etc.  The extreme stress is also debilitating and causes anxiety.  I suffer every day of my life because of this “therapy” and I am no healthier or happier because of it.  I will never forget or forgive the excessive and unnecessary cruelty.  Asking for a little personal space so I don’t gag on your private odors isn’t expecting a lot.

I love that you acknowledged that people have different reactions to this smell and that there are good reasons why.  My friend absolutely hates it-- she says it reminds her of her grandpa's miserable last days in a nursing home, and she's very afraid of aging (one of those "I hope I die before I get very old" people).  I was semi-raised by my grandma and I absolutely love the smell; sometimes I find myself feeling really relaxed or comforted on a public train and then I realize it's because there's an old person near by and they smell good.  It's kind of crazy how closely smells get linked with memories and emotion.
